net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.data

Class FilteredTableModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.data.AbstractTableModel
      • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.data.TableMap
        • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.data.FilteredTableModel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EventListener, TableModelListener, TableModel

    public class FilteredTableModel
extends TableMap
    This class wraps a TableModel and filters the available rows using an implementation of TableRowFilter.
    Author:
    Pat B. Double (double@i2rd.com)

      • getRowCount

        public int getRowCount()
        Description copied from class: TableMap
        Forward to the underlying model. Returns the number of rows in the model. If the number of rows cannot be efficiently determined, this method may return -1. In that case the isRowValid() method can be used to determine if a given row is valid.
        Specified by:
        getRowCount in interface TableModel
        Overrides:
        getRowCount in class TableMap
        Returns:
        The number of rows or -1 if the number of rows cannot efficiently be calculated.

      • getRowId

        public String getRowId(int rowIndex)
        Description copied from class: TableMap
        Forward to the underlying model. Returns null.

        Get an unqiue ID for the row. This ID will be used in some mediums to find the row in the case where the model and user interface become inconsistent. When accessing the table model, the ID may be used to find the row index.

        This method may return null if not supported.

        Specified by:
        getRowId in interface TableModel
        Overrides:
        getRowId in class TableMap
        Parameters:
        rowIndex - The row index.
        Returns:
        String or null if no ID is available.

      • getValueAt

        public Object getValueAt(int aRow,
                int aColumn)
        Description copied from class: TableMap
        Forward to the underlying model. Returns the value for the cell at columnIndex and rowIndex.
        Specified by:
        getValueAt in interface TableModel
        Overrides:
        getValueAt in class TableMap
        Parameters:
        aRow - The row index, in the interval [0,getRowCount()], may be zero even if getRowCount() is zero.
        aColumn - The column index, in the interval [0,getColumnCount()), may be zero even if getColumnCount() is zero.
        Returns:
        Object or null, must return null if the row or column index are invalid.

      • isRowValid

        public boolean isRowValid(int rowIndex)
        Description copied from class: TableMap
        Forward to the underlying model. This implementation of isRowValid() returns true if the rowIndex is in the interval [0,getRowCount()). Returns true if the row is valid in this model. In general a row should be valid if it is less than the value of getRowCount(). Determining getRowCount() may not be efficient for all models so this method is provided to determine if a given row is valid. It is assumed that if a row is invalid, all the rows with an index greater than the row checked are also invalid.
        Specified by:
        isRowValid in interface TableModel
        Overrides:
        isRowValid in class TableMap
        Parameters:
        rowIndex - The row index.
        Returns:
        true if the row is valid.

      • tableChanged

        public void tableChanged(TableModelEvent e)
        Marks the model as needing to be filtered and forwards the event to the underlying model. By default forward all events to all the listeners. This fine grain notification tells listeners the exact range of cells, rows, or columns that changed.
        Specified by:
        tableChanged in interface TableModelListener
        Overrides:
        tableChanged in class TableMap
        Parameters:
        e - The object describing the event.
